bestBHT.bht: The author of Hebrews brings a slight alteration to the covenant mentioned in Jeremiah, adjusting the wording by changing the sequence of heart and mind while maintaining the essence of the promise. The tweak in phrasing highlights the author's meticulousness in preserving the significance of the covenant without changing its meaning.

Archibald T. Robertson: The author changes τω οικω Ισραελ (Hebrews 8:10) thus without altering the sense.
He also changes the order of 'heart' (καρδιας) and 'mind' (διανοιαν) from that in Hebrews 8:10.

John Gill: This is the covenant that I will make with them,....

bhtAttempts.bht: The author of Hebrews tweaks the wording of the covenant promise found in Jeremiah 31:33. Instead of mentioning the house of Israel, the author uses slightly different phrasing while maintaining the same meaning. Additionally, the author changes the order of heart and mind in the verse. These adjustments demonstrate the author's keen attention to detail, ensuring that the essence of the promise remains intact.

The author of Hebrews brings a slight alteration to the covenant mentioned in Jeremiah, adjusting the wording by changing the sequence of heart and mind while maintaining the essence of the promise. The tweak in phrasing highlights the author's meticulousness in preserving the significance of the covenant without changing its meaning.

The author of Hebrews skillfully modifies the covenant statement from Jeremiah, specifically adjusting the order of heart and mind, while keeping the overall meaning intact. This attention to detail showcases the author's fidelity to the original promise, as they maintain the essence of the covenant without altering its significance.

The author of Hebrews carefully rephrases the covenant promise found in Jeremiah, making slight changes to the order of heart and mind, while maintaining the intended meaning. With precision, the author upholds the essence of the covenant.

The author of Hebrews modifies the covenant mentioned in Jeremiah, altering the order of heart and mind without changing the essence of the promise. This attention to detail ensures the fidelity to the original covenant while conveying the same meaning.
